Description: Sliver of flattened handle of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay medium-fine light red-brown; cream slip. Rectangular stamp.
Curator's comments: Petrie Diary (EES Archive XVII 47) p. 132, 20 Name Lysimachos. From same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, ABC 0373.05.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.1725)
